comment.author: 63711213@N03
comment._content: George and Pitt street are parallel. It's not possible to be on the corner of both.

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: Hi mrmarionette, check out the map location - George and Pitt come together near Central Station.
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: In this photograph ( acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823947&am... ) the replacement building is to the right of the church spire
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The building is marked as a "Police Of[fice]" on this 1895 interactive map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0... The Brigade were given temporary use of the building by the Minister of Lands in 1897. SMH 17/2/1897 p.5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14089074
